News.Title: Sanghi Industries Director Ajay Kapur Resigns
News.Summary: Ajay Kapur resigned as Director of Sanghi Industries Limited effective January 31, 2026, following his superannuation as Managing Director of Ambuja Cements Limited.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Q3FY26 Loss Widens to ₹115.39 Crore
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries reported a net loss of ₹115.39 crore for Q3FY26, wider than ₹96.96 crore loss in Q3FY25. Revenue from operations rose 6.19% to ₹275.00 crore. Board appointed Rohit Soni as Additional Director.

News.Title: Adani Cement Partners with Coolbrook for World's First Commercial RotoDynamic Heater Deployment
News.Summary: Adani Cement and Coolbrook announced a delivery agreement for the world's first commercial deployment of RotoDynamic Heater (RDH) technology at the Boyareddypalli Integrated Cement Plant in Andhra Pradesh, India. The RDH system will be powered entirely by Adani Cement's renewable energy portfolio to decarbonize the calcination phase of cement production. The deployment is expected to directly reduce 60,000 tonnes of CO2 emissions annually with potential to increase 10x in due course. The technology will provide clean heat to dry and enhance alternative fuels, enabling higher substitution of fossil fuels. This supports Adani Cement's goals to increase alternative fuel ratio to 30% and achieve 60% green power share by FY28, while advancing their net-zero targets by 2050. The companies plan to launch at least five additional projects within the next two years. The first generation RDH will deliver hot gases at around 1000°C to facilitate drying of alternate fuels.

News.Title: Ambuja Cements Reports 58% Jump in Quarterly EBITDA to INR 1,761 Crores with Strong Volume Growth
News.Summary: Ambuja Cements achieved highest-ever sales volume of 16.6 million tons in the quarter, marking 20% year-on-year growth compared to 4% industry average. The company reported quarterly EBITDA of INR 1,761 crores, up 58% year-on-year, with EBITDA per ton reaching INR 1,060, a 32% increase. Revenue stood at INR 9,174 crores, up 21% year-on-year with 3% price gain. Market share increased by 1% to 16.6%. The company expanded existing capacities to 107 MTPA and revised target capacity to 155 MTPA by FY28 through debottlenecking initiatives. Cost reduction of INR 238 per metric ton was achieved year-on-year, with kiln fuel cost at INR 1.65 per 1,000 kilocalories. Profit after tax reached INR 2,302 crores, up 364%, including a one-time tax write-back of INR 1,697 crores. The company targets total cost of INR 4,000 per metric ton by March 2026. Green power share increased to 33% with renewable energy capacity at 673 megawatts. Premium products comprised 35% of total trade sales with 28% year-on-year growth in premium cement volumes.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Reports Net Loss of Rs 16.55 Crore in Q2, Capacity Utilization Remains Low at 36%
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries Limited reported a net loss of Rs 16.55 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared to a loss of Rs 195.68 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations stood at Rs 204.93 crore versus Rs 151.50 crore in Q2 FY25. The company's cement capacity utilization remained at 36%, same as the previous quarter, with cement sales volume at 0.6 million tonnes. EBITDA improved to Rs 24.9 crore from Rs 3.1 crore in the previous quarter. The company attributed low capacity utilization to heavy monsoon conditions and flood-like situations. Management expects capacity utilization of 70-75% for the remaining part of the year. The company utilized the quarter for scheduled maintenance of kiln line II and rehabilitation of a 15km thermal power plant transmission line. Sanghi Industries has ongoing litigation with Gujarat's Chief Commissioner of State Tax regarding electricity duty exemption and received Rs 40 crore as indemnification claim from erstwhile promoters. The Board has approved a merger scheme with Ambuja Cements Limited, with shareholder meeting scheduled for November 20, 2025.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Announces Shareholder Meeting for Scheme of Arrangement with Ambuja Cements
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries Limited has scheduled an equity shareholders meeting for November 20, 2025, at 11:00 AM IST via video conferencing to consider a Scheme of Arrangement with Ambuja Cements Limited. The meeting follows orders from the National Company Law Tribunal, Ahmedabad Bench dated September 26, 2025 and October 9, 2025. Notice of the meeting has been published in Indian Express (All editions) in English on October 15, 2025 and in Gujarati in Financial Express (Ahmedabad edition) on October 16, 2025. The scheme involves the transfer/merger arrangement between Sanghi Industries (transferor company) and Ambuja Cements (transferee company) and their respective shareholders.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Receives NCLT Order to Convene Shareholder Meeting for Ambuja Cements Merger
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries Limited has received an order from the National Company Law Tribunal, Ahmedabad Bench, directing the company to convene a meeting of equity shareholders on November 20, 2025, at 11:00 a.m. IST through video conference. The meeting will consider and approve the proposed amalgamation scheme with Ambuja Cements Limited, where Sanghi Industries will act as the transferor company and Ambuja Cements as the transferee company. The tribunal order follows an earlier disclosure made by Sanghi Industries on December 17, 2024, regarding the proposed merger arrangement.

News.Title: Adani Group Chairman Addresses Shareholders Following SEBI Dismissal of Hindenburg Allegations
News.Summary: Gautam Adani, Chairman of Adani Group, issued a letter to shareholders of Sanghi Industries Limited addressing the aftermath of Hindenburg's report from January 24, 2023. Adani stated that SEBI delivered a verdict dismissing the allegations against the group. He highlighted the company's financial performance during this period, with portfolio EBITDA growing from ₹57,205 crores in FY23 to ₹89,806 crores in FY25, representing 57% absolute growth and a two-year CAGR of 25%. The Gross Block expanded from ₹4,12,318 crores to ₹6,09,133 crores, adding nearly ₹2 lakh crores. The group commissioned several projects including India's first container transshipment port at Vizhinjam, added 6 GW of renewable capacity including the Khavda project, commissioned a copper smelter complex, and expanded energy infrastructure with 7,000 circuit kms of transmission lines and 4 GW of thermal capacity. Adani committed to strengthening governance standards, accelerating innovation and sustainability, and continuing infrastructure investments.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Seeks Shareholder Approval for Modified Related Party Transactions with Adani Entities
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries Limited has issued a postal ballot notice seeking shareholder approval for material modifications to related party transactions with Adani Enterprises Limited and Adani Cement Industries Limited. The company proposes to modify the previously approved transaction limits without changing the overall approved amount of Rs. 1,000 crore. For AEL and its subsidiary AGPTE, the company seeks to remove the Rs. 50 crore sub-limit for AGPTE while maintaining the combined Rs. 750 crore limit, providing greater sourcing flexibility for solid fuels and shared services. For ACIL, which became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Ambuja Cements (Sanghi's holding company) in August 2025, the company proposes to expand transaction scope to include sale/purchase of cement, clinker, raw materials, and services while maintaining the Rs. 250 crore limit. The e-voting period runs from September 23 to October 22, 2025. The proposed transactions represent 78.11% of Sanghi's annual turnover for AEL/AGPTE transactions and 26.04% for ACIL transactions. All transactions will be conducted on arm's length basis and in ordinary course of business.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Releases Q1 FY26 Earnings Call Transcript
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries Limited has made available the transcript of their earnings conference call discussing unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The transcript has been uploaded to the company's website and submitted to stock exchanges NSE and BSE as part of regulatory disclosure requirements. The earnings call was conducted on July 31, 2025, following earlier communications dated July 18 and July 31, 2025 regarding the scheduled analyst/institutional call.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Submits Q1 FY26 Investor Presentation Ahead of Analyst Call
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries Limited submitted an investor presentation titled 'Operational & Financial Highlights' for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, to stock exchanges NSE and BSE. The presentation will be used during an analyst/institutional call scheduled for July 31, 2025. The document was signed by Company Secretary Pranjali Dubey and made available on the company's website at www.sanghicement.com. The presentation contains detailed financial and operational data for Q1 FY26, including information about Ambuja Cements' performance with sales volume of 18.4 million tonnes, revenue of Rs 10,289 crore, and EBITDA of Rs 1,961 crore.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Reports ₹75.40 Crore Loss for June Quarter, Receives ₹40 Crore Indemnity Payment
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries Limited reported a net loss of ₹75.40 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, compared to ₹88.82 crore loss in the same period last year. Revenue from operations increased to ₹245.38 crore from ₹222.99 crore year-on-year. The company received ₹40 crore as indemnity reimbursement from erstwhile promoters related to electricity duty disputes, which was recorded as exceptional income. Total expenses stood at ₹363.13 crore, with power and fuel costs being the largest component at ₹152.09 crore. The company faces ongoing litigation with Gujarat's Chief Commissioner of State Tax regarding electricity duty exemptions, with provisions of ₹43.90 crore recognized and contingent liability of ₹176.63 crore assessed. A proposed merger scheme with holding company Ambuja Cements Limited has received no-objection certificates from stock exchanges and awaits regulatory approvals. Under the scheme, shareholders will receive 12 equity shares of Ambuja Cements for every 100 shares held in Sanghi Industries.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries: Q4 Loss Widens Despite Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries reported a net loss of ₹117 crore in Q4 FY25, significantly wider than the ₹19 crore loss in Q4 FY24. Revenue grew 17.6% to ₹335.2 crore, but EBITDA fell 38% to ₹36.3 crore. Operating margins contracted to 10.8% from 20.6% due to higher input costs and competitive pressures. The company is currently undergoing an acquisition process by Ambuja Cements.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Reports Decline in Q4 EBITDA
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries has reported a significant decrease in its Q4 EBITDA, which fell to 363 million rupees from 587 million rupees year-over-year. The company's EBITDA margin also declined, dropping to 10.75% from 20.61% in the same period last year.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Reports Increased Q4 Revenue but Wider Net Loss
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries has reported its Q4 financial results. The company's revenue increased to 3.4 billion rupees from 2.8 billion rupees year-over-year. However, the net loss widened significantly to 1.16 billion rupees compared to a loss of 190 million rupees in the same period last year.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Reports Q3 Financial Results
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries has reported its financial results for the third quarter. The company recorded a net loss of 970 million rupees, which is an improvement from the 2 billion rupee loss in the same quarter of the previous year. However, it represents a decline from the previous quarter's loss of 1.96 billion rupees. On a positive note, the company's revenue increased to 2.58 billion rupees, up from 1.89 billion rupees in the same quarter last year.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Reports Significant EBITDA Improvement in Q3
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries has reported a substantial improvement in its financial performance for the third quarter. The company's EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization) showed a gain of 310 million rupees, compared to a loss of 220 million rupees in the same period last year. This represents a year-over-year turnaround in operational profitability. Additionally, the company achieved an EBITDA margin of 11.97% for the quarter, indicating improved operational efficiency.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries Reports Q3 Financial Results
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries has reported its financial results for the third quarter. The company's net loss narrowed to 970 million rupees, compared to a loss of 2 billion rupees in the same period last year. However, the loss widened from 1.96 billion rupees in the previous quarter. Revenue for Q3 increased to 2.58 billion rupees from 1.89 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries to Consider Q3 Results
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries Limited has announced that it will consider its third quarter (Q3) financial results on January 27. This indicates that the company is preparing to release its earnings report for the most recent fiscal quarter.

News.Title: Sanghi Industries: Q2 Operating Profit Turnaround Amid Increased Net Loss
News.Summary: Sanghi Industries reported Q2 EBITDA of Rs 3.1 crore, compared to a loss of Rs 27.9 crore last year. Net loss increased to Rs 196 crore due to an exceptional loss of Rs 121.1 crore. Revenue declined 16.5% YoY to Rs 152 crore.
